data.event: The York district and town taking its name from York County, Western Australia (in turn named after Prince Frederick, Duke of York and Albany), was first settled in 1831, two years after Perth was settled in 1829.

event.title: two years after Perth was settled

data.event: The York district and town taking its name from York County, Western Australia (in turn named after Prince Frederick, Duke of York and Albany), was first settled in 1831, two years after Perth was settled in 1829.
A town was established in 1835 with the release of town allotments and the first buildings were erected in 1836.
A town was established in 1835 with the release of town allotments and the first buildings were erected in 1836.
With the increasing population of the Swan River Settlement in 1830, it became evident that suitable land would have to be discovered for the growing of crops needed to provide necessary food.

event.title: led a small party in the first exploratory journey over the Darling Range during the winter

data.event: Ensign Robert Dale, a 20-year-old officer of the 63rd Regiment, led a small party in the first exploratory journey over the Darling Range during the winter months of 1830, into what was later to become known as the Avon Valley.
By December 1830, 250,000 acres had been allotted, and in January 1831, 80,000 acres.

event.title: the end of 1831 a further 6,030 acres in small lots had been taken up

data.event: Before the end of 1831 a further 6,030 acres in small lots had been taken up.
